gnat.filter.ner
Class AliBabaSpeciesNer

java.lang.Object
  gnat.filter.ner.AliBabaSpeciesNer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter
Deprecated. 

@Deprecated
public class AliBabaSpeciesNer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter

Deprecated: this should be replaced with another species-service running on a dedicated machine.

Recognizes species in a text by invoking a servlet provided by AliBaba (alibaba.informatik.hu-berlin.de/).

Queries AliBaba for species mentioned in a text or abstract for a given PubMed ID. Returns a set of NCBI Taxonomy IDs.


AliBaba runs a tagger with a lexicon derived from NCBI Taxonomy (ca. 200,000 entries) to handle the initial recognition species' names in the given text. Additionally, searches for cell lines mentioned in the text and resolves them to the species they originate from. For instance, a mention of "HeLa cells" get mapped to the species 9606, human, "COS-7 cells" originate from 10090, mouse.

Author:
Jörg Hakenberg <jhakenberg@users.sourceforge.net>

Method Detail

filter

public void filter(Context context,
                   TextRepository textRepository,
                   GeneRepository geneRepository)
Deprecated. 
Description copied from interface: Filter
The minimum filtering method that has to be implemented. A Run will call this method for each filter in sequence.
Each filter can read and potentially change context, textRepository, and geneRepository in this method.

Specified by:
filter in interface Filter

pmidToTaxIDs

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> pmidToTaxIDs(int pmid)
Deprecated. 
Takes a PubMed ID and returns the set of species that are discussed in the corresponding abstract, by invoking AliBaba's species NER tagger on the PubMed ID's abstract, which AliBaba will download or get from its own cache.

Alternatively, use pmidToTaxIDsFromMeSH(int) to search the list of MeSH terms for species; or use #textToTaxIDsAndNames(String) if no PubMed is available.

Parameters:
pmid -
Returns:
Set of NCBI Taxonomy identifiers
See Also:
pmidToTaxIDsFromMeSH(int), #textToTaxIDsAndNames(String)

pmidToTaxIDsFromMeSH

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> pmidToTaxIDsFromMeSH(int pmid)
Deprecated. 
Searches the MeSH annotations of the given PubMed ID for occurrences of species names, instead of annotating the PubMed ID's abstract. This method fetches the MeSH annotations (URL is stored in URL_EUTILS_FETCHMEDLINERECORD_BYPMID and sends them to AliBaba for annotation of species.

Alternatively, use pmidToTaxIDs(int) to annotate the abstract itself; use #textToTaxIDsAndNames(String) if no PubMed is available.

Parameters:
pmid -
Returns:
See Also:
pmidToTaxIDs(int), textToTaxIDsAndNames(String)

textToTaxIDs

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> textToTaxIDs(java.lang.String text)
Deprecated. 
Takes a text and returns a set of species that are discussed therein.
Alternatively, if the PubMed ID of a text is known and only the abstract is needed, run pmidToTaxIDs(int) to get taxon IDs and potentially use cached results.
Use #textToTaxIDsAndNames(String) is you need species IDs and the mentions used to refer to them in the text.

Parameters:
text -
Returns:
a map of NCBI Taxonomy identifiers to names as they occurred in a text
See Also:
pmidToTaxIDs(int), pmidToTaxIDsFromMeSH(int), #textToTaxIDsAndNames(String)

annotatedTextToMap

private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> annotatedTextToMap(java.lang.String annotatedText)
Deprecated. 
Parses a text annotated by AliBaba for species and returns all NCBI Taxonomy IDs as a map to a set of names that were found in the text and refer to that species.

Parameters:
annotatedText -
Returns:

getIndirectReferencesAndNames

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getIndirectReferencesAndNames(java.lang.String text)
Deprecated. 
Looks for indirect mentions of species in a text, for instance by means of cell lines and related terms. Returns a mapping from NCBI Taxon IDs to recognized terms.
For instance, a mention of Jurkat cells clearly indicates that the species is human, Tax ID 9606.

Parameters:
text -
Returns:
